qas.question: What type of starch is used to make the beer Oshikundu?
In what country is the beer Oshikundu produced?
In what country is the beer Tella produced?
What is the name of the millet based porridge like beer made in Kyrgystan?
What is a beer-like beverage in China that is made with rice?
What are various beers made from in Ethiopia?
What is a popular beverage in the far eastern Himalayas?
Where is the rice based Oshikundu found?

context: Around the world, there are many traditional and ancient starch-based drinks classed as beer. In Africa, there are various ethnic beers made from <a0_0><b5_0>sorghum or millet<b5_0/><a0_0/>, such as Oshikundu in <a1_0>Namibia<a1_0/> and Tella in <a2_0>Ethiopia<a2_0/>. Kyrgyzstan also has a beer made from millet; it is a low alcohol, somewhat porridge-like drink called "<a3_0>Bozo<a3_0/>". Bhutan, Nepal, Tibet and Sikkim also use millet in <b6_0>Chhaang<b6_0/>, a popular semi-fermented rice/millet drink in the eastern Himalayas. Further east in <b7_0>China<b7_0/> are found Huangjiu and <a4_0>Choujiu<a4_0/>—traditional rice-based beverages related to beer.
